name: ALBHttpDropInvalidHeaderEnabled
description: Ensures that the ALB is configured to drop invalid HTTP headers.
priorityReason: Invalid headers can introduce security vulnerabilities.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeLoadBalancerAttributes
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve ALB attributes to check for the invalid header configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable the drop invalid headers feature for the ALB.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that enabling this attribute does not break any custom client behavior.

name: ALBWafEnabled
description: Verifies if a WAF is associated with the ALB.
priorityReason: WAF protects the application from known vulnerabilities and attacks.

requiredParametersForFix.name: webAclArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the WAF WebACL to associate with the ALB.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetWebACLForResource
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if a WAF is associated with the ALB.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: AssociateWebACL
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Associate a WAF WebACL with the ALB.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the WAF WebACL is configured and ready for use to prevent blocking legitimate traffic.

name: ALBCrossZoneLoadBalancingEnabled
description: Ensures cross-zone load balancing is enabled for the ALB.
priorityReason: Cross-zone load balancing ensures even traffic distribution across instances in multiple zones.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeLoadBalancerAttributes
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve ALB attributes to check for cross-zone load balancing configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable cross-zone load balancing for the ALB.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that enabling this attribute aligns with your traffic distribution strategy.

name: ALBDeletionProtectionEnabled
description: Ensures deletion protection is enabled for the ALB.
priorityReason: Deletion protection prevents accidental or unauthorized deletion of the ALB.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeLoadBalancerAttributes
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve ALB attributes to check for deletion protection configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable deletion protection for the ALB.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that deletion protection aligns with your operational requirements.

name: ALBLoggingEnabled
description: Ensures access logging is enabled for the ALB.
priorityReason: Access logs help in monitoring and debugging traffic issues.

requiredParametersForFix.name: s3BucketName
requiredParametersForFix.description: The name of the S3 bucket to store access logs.

requiredParametersForFix.name: s3BucketPrefix
requiredParametersForFix.description: The prefix for the access logs in the S3 bucket.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeLoadBalancerAttributes
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve ALB attributes to check for logging configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyLoadBalancerAttributes
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable logging and configure the S3 bucket and prefix for the ALB.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that the specified S3 bucket is correctly configured to receive access logs.

name: APIGatewayV2AccessLogsEnabled
description: Ensures that access logs are enabled for API Gateway V2 HTTP APIs.
priorityReason: Access logs help in monitoring and debugging API traffic issues.

requiredParametersForFix.name: logGroupArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the CloudWatch Log Group to store access logs.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetStagesCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateStageCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable access logs and configure the CloudWatch Log Group for the stage.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the specified CloudWatch Log Group exists and has proper permissions.

name: APIGatewayV2AuthorizationTypeConfigured
description: Verifies that all routes in API Gateway V2 HTTP APIs have authorization configured.
priorityReason: Authorization protects APIs from unauthorized access.

requiredParametersForFix.name: authorizationType
requiredParametersForFix.description: The type of authorization to apply to the API route.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetRoutesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve route information to check for authorization configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateRouteCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update route configuration to include the specified authorization type.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that the chosen authorization method is correctly set up and configured.

name: APIGatewayAssociatedWithWAF
description: Ensures that the API Gateway stages are associated with a WAF WebACL.
priorityReason: WAF provides protection against common web exploits.

requiredParametersForFix.name: webAclArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the WAF WebACL to associate with the API Gateway stage.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetStageCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve stage information to check if it is associated with a WAF WebACL.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the WAF WebACL is properly configured before associating it with the API Gateway stage.

name: APIGatewayCacheEnabledAndEncrypted
description: Ensures that caching is enabled and encrypted for API Gateway stages.
priorityReason: Encrypted caching protects sensitive data and improves performance.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetStageCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve stage information to check caching and encryption settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateStageCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable caching and encryption for the API Gateway stage.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that enabling caching aligns with your performance requirements.

name: APIGatewayExecutionLoggingEnabled
description: Ensures that execution logging is enabled for API Gateway stages.
priorityReason: Execution logs help in debugging and monitoring API requests.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetStageCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve stage information to check execution logging configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateStageCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable execution logging for the API Gateway stage.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure CloudWatch Logs are set up correctly to receive execution logs.

name: AutoScalingGroupELBHealthCheckRequired
description: Ensures that Auto Scaling Groups with load balancers or target groups use ELB health checks.
priorityReason: ELB health checks ensure that unhealthy instances are replaced automatically.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeAutoScalingGroupsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve Auto Scaling Group configurations to check health check settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateAutoScalingGroupCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the health check type of the Auto Scaling Group to ELB.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that the ELB or target group is correctly configured to provide health checks.

name: AutoScalingMultipleAZ
description: Ensures that Auto Scaling Groups are configured to run in multiple Availability Zones.
priorityReason: Multiple AZs improve availability and fault tolerance of the application.

requiredParametersForFix.name: availabilityZones
requiredParametersForFix.description: List of Availability Zones to add to the Auto Scaling Group.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeAutoScalingGroupsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve Auto Scaling Group configurations to check the number of Availability Zones.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateAutoScalingGroupCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that the additional Availability Zones have the necessary capacity and resources.

name: AutoScalingLaunchTemplate
description: Ensures that Auto Scaling Groups use launch templates instead of launch configurations.
priorityReason: Launch templates provide better flexibility and are recommended over launch configurations.

requiredParametersForFix.name: launchTemplateId
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ID of the launch template to associate with the Auto Scaling Group.

requiredParametersForFix.name: launchTemplateVersion
requiredParametersForFix.description: The version of the launch template to use.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeAutoScalingGroupsCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateAutoScalingGroupCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Switch the Auto Scaling Group to use a launch template.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the launch template is properly configured before associating it with the Auto Scaling Group.

name: CloudFrontAccessLogsEnabled
description: Ensures that access logging is enabled for CloudFront distributions.
priorityReason: Access logs help monitor and analyze distribution traffic.

requiredParametersForFix.name: s3BucketName
requiredParametersForFix.description: The name of the S3 bucket to store access logs.

requiredParametersForFix.name: s3BucketPrefix
requiredParametersForFix.description: The prefix for the access logs in the S3 bucket.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetDistributionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the configuration of CloudFront distributions to check logging status.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateDistributionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable access logging and configure the S3 bucket for the CloudFront distribution.

name: CloudFrontAssociatedWithWAF
description: Ensures that CloudFront distributions are associated with a WAF WebACL.
priorityReason: WAF protects the distribution from known vulnerabilities and attacks.

requiredParametersForFix.name: webAclArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the WAF WebACL to associate with the CloudFront distribution.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetDistributionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the configuration of CloudFront distributions to check for WAF WebACL association.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: AssociateWebACLCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the WAF WebACL is properly configured before associating it.

name: CloudFrontDefaultRootObjectConfigured
description: Ensures that a default root object is configured for CloudFront distributions.
priorityReason: A default root object improves user experience by serving content for root domain requests.

requiredParametersForFix.name: defaultRootObject
requiredParametersForFix.description: The default root object to configure for the CloudFront distribution.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetDistributionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the configuration of CloudFront distributions to check for a default root object.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateDistributionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Set a default root object for the CloudFront distribution.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the specified root object exists in the origin bucket or server.

name: CloudFrontNoDeprecatedSSLProtocols
description: Ensures that deprecated SSL protocols like SSLv3 are not enabled for CloudFront distributions.
priorityReason: Deprecated SSL protocols pose security risks and should be disabled.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetDistributionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the configuration of CloudFront distributions to check SSL protocols.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateDistributionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the SSL protocol settings to disable deprecated protocols.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the change aligns with your application's SSL requirements.

name: CloudFrontViewerPolicyHTTPS
description: Ensures that viewer protocol policies enforce HTTPS for all CloudFront distributions.
priorityReason: Enforcing HTTPS ensures secure communication between the client and the distribution.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetDistributionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the configuration of CloudFront distributions to check viewer protocol policies.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateDistributionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update viewer protocol policies to enforce HTTPS for all behaviors.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure all origins are configured to accept HTTPS traffic.

name: CloudWatchLogGroupRetentionPeriodCheck
description: Ensures that CloudWatch log groups have a retention period set.
priorityReason: Setting a retention period ensures that logs do not accumulate indefinitely, which helps manage storage costs.

requiredParametersForFix.name: retentionInDays
requiredParametersForFix.description: The retention period in days for the log group.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeLogGroupsCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutRetentionPolicyCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Set the retention period for the CloudWatch log group.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the chosen retention period meets compliance and data retention policies.

name: CloudWatchAlarmSettingsCheck

priorityReason: Properly configured alarms ensure timely monitoring and response to system events.

requiredParametersForFix.name: alarmParameters
requiredParametersForFix.description: The required parameters to configure the alarm properly.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeAlarmsCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutMetricAlarmCommand

name: CodeBuildProjectEnvironmentPrivilegedCheck
description: Ensures that CodeBuild projects do not have privileged mode enabled in their environment.
priorityReason: Privileged mode can pose a security risk by allowing unrestricted access to resources.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: BatchGetProjectsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve CodeBuild project configurations to check for privileged mode.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateProjectCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Disable privileged mode for the CodeBuild project.

requiredParametersForFix.name: logGroupArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the CloudWatch Log Group to store build logs.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: BatchGetProjectsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve CodeBuild project configurations to check for logging settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateProjectCommand

name: CodeDeployAutoRollbackMonitorEnabled

priorityReason: Monitoring alarms and auto-rollback reduce the risk of failed deployments impacting production.

requiredParametersForFix.name: alarmConfiguration
requiredParametersForFix.description: Configuration for CloudWatch alarms to monitor during deployments.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateDeploymentGroupCommand

name: DynamoDBAutoscalingEnabled
description: Ensures that DynamoDB tables have autoscaling enabled for read and write capacity.
priorityReason: Autoscaling ensures the table can handle varying workloads without manual intervention.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTableCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve table information to check billing mode and autoscaling policies.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeScalingPoliciesCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutScalingPolicyCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the workload patterns are well understood to configure autoscaling appropriately.

name: DynamoDBLastBackupRecoveryPointCreated
description: Ensures that DynamoDB tables have a recent backup or recovery point created within the last 24 hours.
priorityReason: Frequent backups ensure data recovery in case of accidental deletion or corruption.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListBackupsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of backups for the table to check for recent recovery points.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateBackupCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Create a new backup for the DynamoDB table.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that backup policies are aligned with organizational data retention requirements.

name: DynamoDBPITREnabled
description: Ensures that Point-In-Time Recovery (PITR) is enabled for DynamoDB tables.
priorityReason: PITR allows recovery to any point in the last 35 days, enhancing resilience against accidental data loss.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeContinuousBackupsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve table information to check if PITR is enabled.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateContinuousBackupsCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable Point-In-Time Recovery for the table.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure PITR is enabled only on tables requiring this feature to manage costs.

name: DynamoDBTableDeletionProtectionEnabled
description: Ensures that deletion protection is enabled for DynamoDB tables.
priorityReason: Deletion protection prevents accidental deletion of critical tables.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTableCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve table information to check deletion protection settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateTableCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable deletion protection for the table.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure deletion protection aligns with the operational requirements of the application.

name: DynamoDBTableEncryptedKMS
description: Ensures that DynamoDB tables are encrypted using KMS keys.
priorityReason: KMS encryption protects sensitive data stored in DynamoDB tables.

requiredParametersForFix.name: kmsKeyId
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ID of the KMS key to use for encrypting the table.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTableCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateTableCommand

name: EC2EBSVolumeEncryptionEnabled
description: Ensures that all EBS volumes are encrypted.
priorityReason: Encryption protects sensitive data at rest.

requiredParametersForFix.name: kmsKeyId
requiredParametersForFix.description: The KMS key ID to use for encryption.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeVolumesCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyVolumeCommand

name: EC2IMDSv2Required

priorityReason: IMDSv2 mitigates vulnerabilities related to metadata exploitation.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeInstancesCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyInstanceMetadataOptionsCommand

name: EC2DetailedMonitoringEnabled

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: MonitorInstancesCommand

name: EC2InstanceProfileAttached

priorityReason: IAM instance profiles enable secure access to AWS services from EC2 instances.

requiredParametersForFix.name: instanceProfileName
requiredParametersForFix.description: The name of the IAM instance profile to attach.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: AssociateIamInstanceProfileCommand

name: EC2StoppedInstance

priorityReason: Terminating stopped instances reduces costs and frees up resources.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: TerminateInstancesCommand

name: ECRPrivateImageScanningEnabled
description: Ensures that image scanning on push is enabled for ECR repositories.
priorityReason: Enabling image scanning on push helps identify vulnerabilities in container images.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeRepositoriesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve repository configurations to check if image scanning on push is enabled.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutImageScanningConfigurationCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the repository content complies with scanning requirements.

name: ECRPrivateLifecyclePolicyConfigured
description: Ensures that lifecycle policies are configured for ECR repositories.
priorityReason: Lifecycle policies help manage repository storage by automatically removing unneeded images.

requiredParametersForFix.name: lifecyclePolicyText
requiredParametersForFix.description: The JSON-formatted lifecycle policy text.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetLifecyclePolicyCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutLifecyclePolicyCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the lifecycle policy aligns with retention requirements.

name: ECRPrivateTagImmutabilityEnabled
description: Ensures that tag immutability is enabled for ECR repositories.
priorityReason: Tag immutability prevents overwriting tags, ensuring image stability and integrity.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeRepositoriesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve repository configurations to check if tag immutability is enabled.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutImageTagMutabilityCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable tag immutability for the repository.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that enabling tag immutability does not disrupt existing workflows.

name: ECRKmsEncryption
description: Ensures that ECR repositories are encrypted using KMS keys.
priorityReason: KMS encryption secures sensitive container images at rest.

requiredParametersForFix.name: kmsKeyId
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ID of the KMS key to use for encryption.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeRepositoriesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve repository configurations to check encryption settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutRepositoryPolicyCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable encryption for the repository using the specified KMS key.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the KMS key is properly configured and accessible.

name: ECSAwsvpcNetworkingEnabled
description: Ensures that ECS task definitions use the `awsvpc` networking mode.
priorityReason: Using the `awsvpc` networking mode provides each task with its own elastic network interface, improving network isolation.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve task definition details to check the networking mode.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RegisterTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the task definition to use the `awsvpc` networking mode.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the ECS cluster and tasks are configured to support `awsvpc` networking mode.

name: ECSContainersNonPrivileged
description: Ensures that ECS containers do not run in privileged mode.
priorityReason: Privileged mode can give containers elevated access to the host system, posing a security risk.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve task definition details to check container privilege settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RegisterTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the task definition to disable privileged mode.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the containers do not require privileged mode for their operations.

name: ECSContainersReadOnlyAccess
description: Ensures that ECS containers have a read-only root filesystem where applicable.
priorityReason: A read-only root filesystem limits the ability of attackers to modify the system and improves security.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve task definition details to check root filesystem settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RegisterTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the task definition to enable a read-only root filesystem.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Verify that containers can operate with a read-only root filesystem.

name: ECSContainerInsightsEnabled
description: Ensures that ECS clusters have Container Insights enabled.
priorityReason: Container Insights provides detailed monitoring metrics and logs for ECS clusters and services.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeClustersCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve ECS cluster configurations to check for Container Insights settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateClusterSettingsCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure CloudWatch is configured to receive metrics and logs from Container Insights.

name: ECSTaskDefinitionLogConfiguration
description: Ensures that ECS task definitions include a log configuration.
priorityReason: Log configuration ensures that container logs are sent to a centralized logging service such as CloudWatch.

requiredParametersForFix.name: logDriver
requiredParametersForFix.description: The log driver to use for the task definition.

requiredParametersForFix.name: logOptions
requiredParametersForFix.description: The options for the log driver, such as log group name and region.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve task definition details to check for log configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RegisterTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the task definition to include a log configuration.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the log group exists and is configured to receive logs.

name: ECSTaskDefinitionMemoryHardLimit
description: Ensures that ECS containers specify a memory hard limit in the task definition.
priorityReason: Specifying a memory hard limit prevents containers from consuming excessive memory, protecting other processes.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve task definition details to check memory limit settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RegisterTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the task definition to specify a memory hard limit.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure containers are tested with the specified memory limits.

name: ECSTaskDefinitionNonRootUser
description: Ensures that ECS containers run as a non-root user.
priorityReason: Running containers as a non-root user reduces the risk of privilege escalation attacks.

requiredParametersForFix.name: user
requiredParametersForFix.description: The user to run the container as.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve task definition details to check the container user settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RegisterTaskDefinitionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the task definition to run the container as a non-root user.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the application can run with non-root permissions.

name: EFSAccessPointEnforceRootDirectory
description: Ensures that EFS access points enforce a non-root directory for enhanced security.
priorityReason: Restricting access to specific directories reduces the risk of data exposure.

requiredParametersForFix.name: path
requiredParametersForFix.description: The path to enforce as the root directory for the access point.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeAccessPointsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve information about EFS access points to check their root directory configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateAccessPointCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that the directory path is properly configured and exists in the file system.

name: EFSAccessPointEnforceUserIdentity
description: Ensures that EFS access points enforce a user identity for operations.
priorityReason: Enforcing a user identity ensures accountability and proper access control.

requiredParametersForFix.name: posixUser
requiredParametersForFix.description: The POSIX user configuration to enforce on the access point.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeAccessPointsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve access point details to check POSIX user settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateAccessPointCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Reconfigure the access point to enforce a user identity.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the specified POSIX user is valid and properly configured in the file system.

name: EFSAutomaticBackupsEnabled
description: Ensures that automatic backups are enabled for EFS file systems.
priorityReason: Automatic backups ensure data recovery in case of accidental deletion or corruption.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeBackupPolicyCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check the backup policy for EFS file systems.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutBackupPolicyCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Verify backup retention policies align with organizational requirements.

name: EFSEncryptedCheck
description: Ensures that EFS file systems are encrypted at rest.
priorityReason: Encryption at rest protects sensitive data stored in EFS file systems.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeFileSystemsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if the file systems are encrypted.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateFileSystemCommand

name: EFSMountTargetPublicAccessible

priorityReason: Restricting public access prevents unauthorized access to file systems.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeMountTargetsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve information about mount targets to check public accessibility.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeRouteTablesCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyMountTargetSecurityGroupsCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the security group rules align with organizational access policies.

name: EKSClusterLoggingEnabled
description: Ensures that EKS clusters have all logging types enabled.
priorityReason: Enabling cluster logging ensures better monitoring, troubleshooting, and compliance.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeClusterCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve cluster details to check logging configurations.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateClusterConfigCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable all available logging types for the EKS cluster.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure enabling logging will not impact current cluster performance or cost significantly.

name: EKSClusterSecretsEncrypted
description: Ensures that EKS clusters use KMS encryption for secrets.
priorityReason: Encrypting secrets enhances security and meets compliance requirements.

requiredParametersForFix.name: kmsKeyArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the KMS key to use for secrets encryption.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeClusterCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if the cluster has encryption enabled for secrets.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: AssociateEncryptionConfigCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Add encryption configuration to the EKS cluster.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the specified KMS key is available and properly configured for the cluster.

name: EKSEndpointNoPublicAccess
description: Ensures that EKS cluster endpoints are not publicly accessible.
priorityReason: Restricting public access prevents unauthorized access to the cluster.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeClusterCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve cluster endpoint configuration to check public access settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateClusterConfigCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Disable public access for the cluster endpoint.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure private access is properly configured before disabling public access.

name: ElastiCacheAutoMinorVersionUpgradeCheck
description: Ensures that Auto Minor Version Upgrade is enabled for ElastiCache clusters.
priorityReason: Keeping clusters updated with minor versions ensures they receive the latest security patches and bug fixes.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeCacheClustersCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve cluster configurations to check Auto Minor Version Upgrade settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyCacheClusterCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable Auto Minor Version Upgrade for the cluster.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure enabling minor version upgrades aligns with application compatibility.

name: ElastiCacheRedisClusterAutomaticBackupCheck
description: Ensures that automatic backups are enabled for ElastiCache Redis clusters.
priorityReason: Automatic backups are crucial for data recovery in case of accidental deletion or corruption.

requiredParametersForFix.name: snapshotRetentionLimit
requiredParametersForFix.description: The number of days to retain backups.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeReplicationGroupsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if automatic backups are enabled for replication groups.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyReplicationGroupCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable automatic backups for the Redis replication group.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Verify the snapshot retention policy aligns with organizational recovery requirements.

name: ElastiCacheReplicationGroupAutoFailoverEnabled
description: Ensures that Auto Failover is enabled for ElastiCache replication groups.
priorityReason: Auto Failover ensures high availability and reduces downtime during node failures.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeReplicationGroupsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve replication group configurations to check Auto Failover settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyReplicationGroupCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable Auto Failover for the replication group.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure enabling Auto Failover aligns with application high availability requirements.

name: ElastiCacheReplicationGroupEncryptedAtRest
description: Ensures that ElastiCache replication groups are encrypted at rest.
priorityReason: Encryption at rest protects sensitive data stored in ElastiCache from unauthorized access.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeReplicationGroupsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if encryption at rest is enabled for replication groups.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateReplicationGroupCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Recreate the replication group with encryption enabled.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure data migration and application downtime are planned before recreating the replication group.

name: ElastiCacheReplicationGroupEncryptedInTransit
description: Ensures that ElastiCache replication groups are encrypted in transit.
priorityReason: Encryption in transit protects data from unauthorized access during transmission.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeReplicationGroupsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if encryption in transit is enabled for replication groups.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateReplicationGroupCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Recreate the replication group with encryption in transit enabled.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that enabling encryption in transit does not disrupt application connectivity.

name: ElastiCacheSubnetGroupCheck
description: Ensures that ElastiCache clusters are not using the default subnet group.
priorityReason: Using a custom subnet group ensures better control over network configurations.

requiredParametersForFix.name: subnetGroupName
requiredParametersForFix.description: The name of the custom subnet group to use.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeCacheClustersCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve cluster configurations to check subnet group settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyCacheClusterCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the cluster to use a custom subnet group.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the custom subnet group is properly configured and meets network requirements.

name: IAMPolicyNoStatementsWithAdminAccess
description: Ensures that IAM policies do not contain statements granting full administrative access.
priorityReason: Granting full administrative access violates the principle of least privilege and poses a security risk.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListPoliciesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of local IAM policies.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetPolicyVersionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the default version of IAM policies to analyze their statements.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreatePolicyVersionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Create a new policy version with restricted permissions.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: SetDefaultPolicyVersionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Set the new policy version as the default.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Review the policy requirements to ensure removing administrative access will not disrupt operations.

name: IAMPolicyNoStatementsWithFullAccess
description: Ensures that IAM policies do not contain statements granting full access to specific services.
priorityReason: Granting full access to specific services can lead to unintentional misuse or privilege escalation.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListPoliciesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of local IAM policies.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetPolicyVersionCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the default version of IAM policies to analyze their statements.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreatePolicyVersionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Create a new policy version with restricted permissions.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: SetDefaultPolicyVersionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Set the new policy version as the default.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Review the policy requirements to ensure removing full access permissions will not disrupt operations.

name: IAMRoleManagedPolicyCheck
description: Ensures that managed policies are attached to IAM roles, groups, or users.
priorityReason: Attaching managed policies ensures consistent permissions and simplifies policy management.

requiredParametersForFix.name: roleName
requiredParametersForFix.description: The name of the IAM role to attach the managed policy to.

requiredParametersForFix.name: policyArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the managed policy to attach.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListPoliciesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of managed IAM policies.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListEntitiesForPolicyCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check which entities are attached to each managed policy.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: AttachRolePolicyCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Attach a managed policy to an IAM role.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the managed policy aligns with the role's intended permissions.

name: LambdaDLQCheck
description: Ensures that AWS Lambda functions have a Dead Letter Queue (DLQ) configured.
priorityReason: Configuring a DLQ ensures that failed Lambda invocations are captured for troubleshooting and analysis.

requiredParametersForFix.name: dlqArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the Dead Letter Queue to configure.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListFunctionsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of Lambda functions to check for DLQ configurations.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateFunctionConfigurationCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Configure a Dead Letter Queue for the Lambda function.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the DLQ exists and has the appropriate permissions to receive failed messages.

name: LambdaFunctionPublicAccessProhibited
description: Ensures that AWS Lambda functions are not publicly accessible.
priorityReason: Publicly accessible Lambda functions can lead to security vulnerabilities and unauthorized usage.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetPolicyCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the Lambda function's resource-based policy to check for public access.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RemovePermissionCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Remove any permissions that grant public access to the Lambda function.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Verify that removing public access will not disrupt intended functionality.

name: LambdaFunctionSettingsCheck
description: Ensures that AWS Lambda functions do not use default settings for timeout and memory.
priorityReason: Customizing timeout and memory settings optimizes function performance and cost.

requiredParametersForFix.name: timeout
requiredParametersForFix.description: The timeout duration (in seconds) for the Lambda function.

requiredParametersForFix.name: memorySize
requiredParametersForFix.description: The memory size (in MB) allocated to the Lambda function.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListFunctionsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of Lambda functions to check their settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateFunctionConfigurationCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update the function's timeout and memory settings.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the updated settings align with the function's performance and cost requirements.

name: LambdaInsideVPC
description: Ensures that AWS Lambda functions are configured to run inside a VPC.
priorityReason: Running Lambda functions inside a VPC provides additional security and control over network traffic.

requiredParametersForFix.name: subnetIds
requiredParametersForFix.description: The subnet IDs for the Lambda function to use.

requiredParametersForFix.name: securityGroupIds
requiredParametersForFix.description: The security group IDs for the Lambda function to use.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListFunctionsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of Lambda functions to check their VPC configurations.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateFunctionConfigurationCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Configure the function to use a VPC.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the specified subnets and security groups are configured correctly and have necessary permissions.

name: AuroraLastBackupRecoveryPointCreated
description: Ensures that Aurora DB clusters have a recent recovery point created.
priorityReason: Recent backups ensure data recovery in case of accidental deletion or corruption.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeDBClustersCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of Aurora DB clusters.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeDBClusterSnapshotsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check the most recent recovery point for each cluster.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateDBClusterSnapshotCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Create a new recovery point for the Aurora DB cluster.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the DB cluster is in a stable state before creating a snapshot.

name: AuroraMySQLBacktrackingEnabled
description: Ensures that backtracking is enabled for Aurora MySQL clusters.
priorityReason: Backtracking allows quick recovery from accidental data modifications.

requiredParametersForFix.name: backtrackWindow
requiredParametersForFix.description: The backtracking window in seconds.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeDBClustersCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of Aurora MySQL clusters and check their backtracking configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyDBClusterCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable backtracking for the Aurora MySQL cluster.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure enabling backtracking does not disrupt the current cluster configuration.

name: DBInstanceBackupEnabled
description: Ensures that backups are enabled for RDS instances.
priorityReason: Enabling backups is critical for disaster recovery and data protection.

requiredParametersForFix.name: backupRetentionPeriod
requiredParametersForFix.description: The number of days to retain automated backups.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeDBInstancesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of RDS instances and check their backup settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyDBInstanceCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable automated backups for the RDS instance.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the backup retention policy meets organizational recovery requirements.

name: RDSClusterIAMAuthenticationEnabled
description: Ensures that IAM authentication is enabled for RDS clusters.
priorityReason: IAM authentication simplifies credential management and enhances security.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeDBClustersCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of RDS clusters and check their IAM authentication settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyDBClusterCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable IAM authentication for the RDS cluster.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure IAM roles are properly configured to support database authentication.

name: RDSClusterDeletionProtectionEnabled
description: Ensures that deletion protection is enabled for RDS clusters.
priorityReason: Deletion protection prevents accidental deletion of critical RDS clusters.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeDBClustersCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of RDS clusters and check their deletion protection settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyDBClusterCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable deletion protection for the RDS cluster.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure deletion protection aligns with operational requirements and does not block intentional deletions.

name: RDSClusterEncryptedAtRest
description: Ensures that RDS clusters are encrypted at rest.
priorityReason: Encryption at rest protects sensitive data stored in RDS clusters.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeDBClustersCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of RDS clusters and check their encryption settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateDBClusterCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Recreate the RDS cluster with encryption enabled.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure data migration is planned before recreating the RDS cluster with encryption.

name: S3BucketVersioningEnabled
description: Ensures that S3 bucket versioning is enabled.
priorityReason: Enabling versioning helps protect against accidental overwrites and deletions.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetBucketVersioningCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if versioning is enabled for the S3 bucket.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutBucketVersioningCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable versioning for the S3 bucket.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that enabling versioning aligns with cost and recovery policies.

name: S3BucketSSLRequestsOnly
description: Ensures that S3 buckets require SSL for requests.
priorityReason: Requiring SSL ensures secure data transmission to and from the bucket.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetBucketPolicyCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the bucket policy to check for SSL enforcement.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutBucketPolicyCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Update or create a bucket policy to enforce SSL requests.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Review the impact of enforcing SSL on applications accessing the bucket.

name: S3BucketLoggingEnabled
description: Ensures that S3 bucket logging is enabled.
priorityReason: Bucket logging helps in auditing and monitoring access patterns.

requiredParametersForFix.name: targetBucket
requiredParametersForFix.description: The target bucket for storing access logs.

requiredParametersForFix.name: targetPrefix

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetBucketLoggingCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the bucket logging configuration.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: PutBucketLoggingCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable logging for the S3 bucket.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the target bucket exists and has the necessary permissions for logging.

name: S3BucketDefaultLockEnabled
description: Ensures that S3 Object Lock is enabled by default on buckets.
priorityReason: Object Lock protects objects against deletion or modification for a specified period.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetObjectLockConfigurationCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if the S3 bucket has default Object Lock enabled.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateBucketCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Recreate the bucket with Object Lock enabled.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Recreating a bucket deletes its existing data. Ensure proper data migration is planned.

name: S3AccessPointInVPCOnly
description: Ensures that S3 access points are restricted to a VPC.
priorityReason: Restricting access points to a VPC enhances security by limiting access to internal networks.

requiredParametersForFix.name: vpcId

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListAccessPointsCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateAccessPointCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the specified VPC is correctly configured for S3 access.

name: SecretsManagerRotationEnabledCheck
description: Ensures that secret rotation is enabled for AWS Secrets Manager secrets.
priorityReason: Enabling rotation reduces the risk of credential compromise by regularly updating them.

requiredParametersForFix.name: rotationLambdaARN
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the Lambda function to handle rotation.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListSecretsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of Secrets Manager secrets.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RotateSecretCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable rotation for the secret.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that the rotation Lambda function is configured correctly to handle secret updates.

name: SecretsManagerScheduledRotationSuccessCheck
description: Ensures that secrets with rotation enabled have been rotated successfully within the scheduled time.
priorityReason: Ensuring timely rotation protects against stale or compromised credentials.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListSecretsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of Secrets Manager secrets.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RotateSecretCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Force rotation of the secret to update it.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Verify that the rotation Lambda function is active and can handle forced rotation.

name: SecretsManagerSecretPeriodicRotation
description: Ensures that secrets are rotated periodically, at least every 90 days.
priorityReason: Periodic rotation helps mitigate risks of long-lived credentials.

requiredParametersForFix.name: rotationDays
requiredParametersForFix.description: The number of days after which the secret should be rotated.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListSecretsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of Secrets Manager secrets.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: UpdateSecretCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Set the rotation schedule for the secret.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure rotation rules align with organizational policies and application dependencies.

name: SecurityHubEnabled
description: Ensures that AWS Security Hub is enabled for the AWS account.
priorityReason: Enabling Security Hub is critical for monitoring and managing security across AWS accounts.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeHubCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if Security Hub is enabled in the account.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: EnableSecurityHubCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable Security Hub for the account.

name: SNSEncryptedKMS
description: Ensures that SNS topics are encrypted using KMS keys.
priorityReason: Encrypting SNS topics helps protect sensitive data transmitted via notifications.

requiredParametersForFix.name: kmsKeyId
requiredParametersForFix.description: The KMS key ID or ARN to encrypt the SNS topic.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListTopicsCommand

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetTopicAttributesCommand

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: SetTopicAttributesCommand

name: SNSTopicMessageDeliveryNotificationEnabled

priorityReason: Enabling delivery notifications ensures visibility into message delivery status.

requiredParametersForFix.name: feedbackRoleArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the IAM role to enable delivery notifications.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: ListTopicsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of SNS topics.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: GetTopicAttributesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Check if delivery notifications are enabled for each topic.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: SetTopicAttributesCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable delivery notifications for the SNS topic.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure the IAM role has the appropriate permissions to manage delivery notifications.

name: EC2TransitGatewayAutoVPCAttachDisabled
description: Ensures that the auto-attach feature of Transit Gateways is disabled.
priorityReason: Disabling auto-attach ensures manual control over VPC attachments, enhancing security and governance.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeTransitGatewaysCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of Transit Gateways and check their auto-attach settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifyTransitGatewayCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Disable the auto-attach feature for the Transit Gateway.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Verify that no active auto-attached VPCs will be impacted by disabling this feature.

name: RestrictedSSH
description: Ensures that SSH access (port 22) is restricted to trusted sources.
priorityReason: Restricting SSH access prevents unauthorized access to resources and strengthens security.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeSecurityGroupRulesCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve security group rules to check for unrestricted SSH access.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RevokeSecurityGroupIngressCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Revoke rules allowing unrestricted SSH access.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure that legitimate users have alternative access paths before restricting SSH access.

name: SubnetAutoAssignPublicIPDisabled
description: Ensures that subnets are not configured to automatically assign public IP addresses.
priorityReason: Disabling automatic public IP assignment helps prevent unintended exposure of resources to the internet.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeSubnetsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of subnets and check their public IP assignment settings.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: ModifySubnetAttributeCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Disable automatic public IP assignment for the subnet.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure no essential resources require public IPs before disabling this feature.

name: VPCFlowLogsEnabled
description: Ensures that flow logs are enabled for all VPCs.
priorityReason: Enabling flow logs provides visibility into network traffic and helps with troubleshooting and auditing.

requiredParametersForFix.name: logGroupName
requiredParametersForFix.description: The name of the CloudWatch log group to store flow logs.

requiredParametersForFix.name: iamRoleArn
requiredParametersForFix.description: The ARN of the IAM role with permissions to publish flow logs to CloudWatch.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeVpcsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve the list of VPCs and check if flow logs are enabled.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: CreateFlowLogsCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Enable flow logs for the VPC.

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure CloudWatch and IAM role configurations are prepared to handle the new logs.

name: VPCDefaultSecurityGroupClosed
description: Ensures that default security groups have no inbound or outbound rules.
priorityReason: Closing default security groups prevents unintended access and strengthens security.

commandUsedInCheckFunction.name: DescribeSecurityGroupsCommand
commandUsedInCheckFunction.reason: Retrieve default security groups and check their rules.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RevokeSecurityGroupIngressCommand
commandUsedInFixFunction.reason: Remove all inbound rules from the default security group.

commandUsedInFixFunction.name: RevokeSecurityGroupEgressCommand

adviseBeforeFixFunction: Ensure no critical dependencies are relying on the default security group rules.
